Description: Upper body sherd of Clazomenian black-figured pottery closed vessel, possibly a neck-amphora; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of bearded satyr to left playing aulos (lower part of face and beard, upper body with dots in added red, arms and aulos flute remaining).
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Described by Lorimer 1905, 121, as "Ware of Defenneh type".
Bibliographic references: CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 88, pl. X, no. 21.)
Hogarth, Lorimer & Edgar 1905 / Naukratis 1903 (p. 121, pl. VI, no. 3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GH.012) (Phase 1)
Jones 1986 / Greek and Cypriot Pottery: a Review of Scientific Studies (p.701, table 8.18, no.21)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
